title: HTML Favicon
gp1: A favicon is a small image displayed next to the page title in the browser tab.
gp2: A favicon image is displayed to the left of the page title in the browser tab, like this:
gp3: To add a favicon to your website, either save your favicon image to the root directory of your webserver, or create a folder in the root directory called images, and save your favicon image in this folder. A common name for a favicon image is 'favicon.ico'.
gp4: Now, save the 'index.html' file and reload it in your browser. Your browser tab should now display your favicon image to the left of the page title.
wp1: Next, add a <link> element to your 'index.html' file, after the <title> element, like this:
wp2: Tip: A favicon is a small image, so it should be a simple image with high contrast.
wp3: Use the HTML <link> element to insert a favicon
wp4: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
